top_categories.workout_context: 88ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Kettle Mettle's BC mountains, Canadian gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 80 miles.
At Kettle Mettle, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Kettle Mettle's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Kettle Mettle. Train it until it feels boring.
7,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
At mile 60 of 80, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
7,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Kettle Mettle, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 80 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 80 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on bC mountain gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Kettle Mettle’s 80 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Kettle Mettle. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Kettle Mettle requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on bc mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: bc mountains, canadian gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 80 miles of bc mountain gravel in British Columbia, Canada.
